question:
If g is an integer and x is a prime number, which of the following must be an integer?
Indicate all such expressions.
A. \(\dfrac{g^2x+5gx}{x}\)
B. \(g^2-x^2 \dfrac{1}{3}\)
C. \(6 (\dfrac{g}{2})-100 (\dfrac{g}{2})^2\)

Hide
